description: An ancient city on the island of Sicily, now known as Agrigento. A UNESCO World Heritage Site.

names.description: A toponym used by Pliny the Elder.
names.details: Pliny the Elder identifies Akragas as an "oppidum" and indicates that the toponym variant "Agragas" is an earlier rendering of the city's name.
The city of Agrigento was called Girgenti from Norman times to 1929, when it officially received its current name.
